Name: Dream of A Rusted Sword: Part I
Description: In a valley scarred by the Dark Tide, an old Gladiator silently awaits his destiny. Like an ancient, rusted sword, he dreams of past glories.
QuestDesc: In a valley scarred by the Dark Tide, an old Gladiator silently awaits his destiny. Like an ancient, rusted sword, he dreams of past glories.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kamron
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe I should go look for him, Captain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bezos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just wait. He usually comes back around this time.

Options.PlotLineKey: Did something happen?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bezos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, we recently found traces of a Corrosaurus we've been tracking for a while. It's a slippery one, hiding itself in the Wastelands. Sending too many people in isn't a wise move.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bezos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A senior Gladiator from our camp knows the terrain well. He's a perfect candidate to scout for it. But now he's…

Dialogues.Speaker: Kamron
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He's chickening out! Just like those cowards who deserve no blessing from the eternal sun!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bezos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Watch your tongue, Kamron! Show some respect, or you'll disgrace your mentor!

Dialogues.Speaker: Kamron
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tch... Sorry for how I put it, but still... You aren't changing my mind about him!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bezos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Apologies for the nonsense. We've just had a hard time keeping track of him lately. Wait... could I trouble you to help us find him?

Options.PlotLineKey: Leave it to me.
I could even help deal with that Corrosaurus.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bezos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you. I'll share all the intel we've gathered with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bezos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Ephor spoke highly of you, and clearly for good reason. Still, I'd recommend finding that Gladiator first. With him leading the way, you'll save a lot of time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bezos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll share all the intel we've gathered with you.
Time to run, Gramp! Another one's coming our way!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Gramp"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Quiet! I can see it just fine! Keep shouting and you'll draw even more of them! Got it?
G-GOT IT!
Thanks a bunch for the help! Gramp's back has been acting up lately. If it were just the two of us, who knows how long we'd have been stuck out here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rolla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By the way, I'm Rolla. What's your name?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Gramp"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...You're the Champion of this year's Great Agon, aren't you? Name's {PlayerName}?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rolla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whoa, I never thought I'd run into the Champion in person!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Gramp"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fighting people and fighting Dark Tide beasts aren't the same, but you've got the skills for both. Born with the gifts, I'd say?

Options.PlotLineKey: Years of practice.
I learn from my opponents.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Gramp"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hah, you're good at talking crap too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rolla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, don't mind him, Champion. The old timer's a bit grumpy these days. He roasts everyone.

Options.PlotLineKey: Someone from the camp is looking for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rolla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Because of the Corrosaurus, right? We were sent to track it down! Gramp actually spotted it a while ago!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Gramp"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's head back.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This doesn't seem the way back to the Hunter's Den.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rolla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nope, we're heading back to our camp.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks, Aeolus. Any anomalies?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you mean the Corrosaurus, no. It hasn't found this camp yet. But there's a Kerasaur sneaking around.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tsk, that thing's roar is ear-splitting. If we're not careful, it could draw the Corrosaurus right to us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Shame to abandon a camp like this with such perfect terrain. Look at it. Hills for cover, water all around—

Dialogues.Speaker: Rolla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By water, you mean the Dark Tide, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …You really are a mood killer, Rolla. Can't you tell I was trying to lighten the mood?

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you Gladiators as well?

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We were.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not to brag, but back in the day, we were household names. Until we got fed up with the sponsors and nobles. That's when we walked away.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You must have heard the name Gren back in Septimont City, haven't you? I even endorsed drinks once.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rolla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That was forever ago, Coach. This here is {PlayerName}, the newest Champion of the Great Agon!

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seriously? And I thought that Lupa girl was already something. Now there's another one?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rolla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No kidding! Ask Aeolus!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll handle the Kerasaur. We can't let it get any closer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rolla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alone? But you're still injured!

Options.PlotLineKey: I'll go with you.
At least patch yourself up first.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No need.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, should I take this as your official acceptance to join our team, Aeolus?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm going to deal with the Kerasaur. That's all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then take Rolla with you. It's about time she fights one herself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And to make sure she comes back in one piece, {PlayerName} should go too. Sound fair?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …Don't think this earns you my thanks, Gren.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What, are you trying to crush Rolla's spirit, Gladiator Aeolus?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmph. Fine. I'll patch up. Then we move.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rolla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are Kerasaurs really that dangerous, Champion?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rolla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Coach Gren always said he could take one down single-handedly in his prime… But Gramp's always going on about the "nine rules" of fighting a Kerasaur.

Options.PlotLineKey: I can take a Kerasaur with just one finger.
You have to give it your all against any opponent.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rolla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aha, now that's the Champion talking! One finger, huh? That makes you, like, five times stronger than Coach!

Dialogues.Speaker: Rolla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You sound just like Gramp...

Dialogues.Speaker: Rolla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm… now I'm curious what Gramp was like when he was younger.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You don't know? I thought you've always been together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rolla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nope. He only showed up after we set up this camp not long ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rolla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Before that, I was roaming the Plateaus with Coach Gren and the others, scraping by wherever we could find shelter. But we always avoided Gladiators.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rolla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Coach used to say they were a bunch of stiff guys who'd do anything in the name of "a brighter future for Septimont." He's not a fan of people with no sense of humor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rolla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But Gramp seems to know Coach Gren well. He's always looking out for me... Wait—don't tell me he's actually my real grandpa?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You know, that "Gramp" Aeolus is actually about eight years younger than me. Hard to believe, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let me tell you the secret to staying young: keep your sense of humor! I heard you're from Huanglong? People there have a saying... hmm, what was it again—"Laugh more, live longer"? Haha!

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, I'll leave Rolla in your care. It's been years, and Aeolus's skills haven't improved one bit. That stubborn old man...

Options.PlotLineKey: Why don't you go with them yourself?
You're more than capable of keeping them both safe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, no can do. Not this time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It takes someone as strong as you to make Aeolus drop the whole Gladiator thing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I bet you've got a lot of questions on your mind right now—"What's your relationship with Aeolus?" "Why did you try to stop him from being a Gladiator?" "Is Rolla really his family?"

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, I'm afraid those answers are yours to uncover on your little journey.

Options.PlotLineKey: Why, did you carve them on stones along the way?
I'm not that nosy...

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pfft, you've got a sense of humor, eh! Didn't expect someone your age to crack better jokes than me. Wait… don't tell me you're actually older than I am?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You can return to the camp now. Tell them I'll bring back the intel soon.

Options.PlotLineKey: I promised Gren I'd keep an eye on Rolla.
It won't take long to hunt a Kerasaur.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rolla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, come on, Gramp! Why so stubborn today? Let's just go!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those are its footprints. It's larger and heavier than normal ones. The stride is steady. No signs of injury or irregular movement.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No traces of battle with other Dark Tide creations along the way either...

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like its frequency alone was enough to scare off the others. Could it be... a special variant?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rolla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's that, Gramp?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An illusive realm that often appears after the High Tide. Some say it's a fragment of a certain type of Sonoro.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've seen similar things in places tainted by the Dark Tide… but none of them looked as real as this one.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rolla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then let's get a closer look!

Dialogues.Speaker: Rolla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This place… Looks like it used to be a smithy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The best you could find on the Plateaus.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For a Gladiator, their weapon is their second life. This was where many first came, when they set out to chase greatness.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I got my first sword here too. Many years ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rolla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Really? But I've never seen you use it. Did you treasure it that much?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Time to go.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The frequency has stirred. It's pointing in a specific direction.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It might be affected by the Kerasaur's frequency. If we follow it, we might find some clues.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Judging by the size of these scratches… and how deep they go into the stone… This one's definitely a mutant.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rolla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The illusive realm appears again!

Dialogues.Speaker: Rolla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look, Gramp—there's someone inside!

Dialogues.Speaker: Hunter's Phantom
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did you hear that noise? That girl is hunting the Lion Beast all by herself. A fight like that is bound to attract more danger. Even if she takes it down, she'll need backup.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hunter's Phantom
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We have to help her... Are you hurt?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rolla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Lion Beast and a girl... Could this be the moment when Ephor Augusta hunted it down?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (But the tale of Augusta's trial only mentions an old hunter. Who's this second person?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Someone left out of the story...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rolla, head back to camp. We need reinforcements.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rolla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Eh? But Coach Gren said—

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just go!

Dialogues.Speaker: Rolla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You don't have to yell, okay? Got it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Strong Dark Tide creations are drawn to powerful frequencies. I know where that Kerasaur's heading.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know what you want to ask, but once we get there, you'll understand everything.

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you alright?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha... you are insanely strong.

Options.PlotLineKey: Power comes at a price.
You gain strength, but you lose things in return.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Must be a price too heavy for me to take.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But most people lose everything and still gain no strength.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Follow me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Watch its tail!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's most vulnerable when it swings that thing to attack!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What is this sword?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It belonged to Master Cato, Augusta's coach. He once wielded it against the Dark Tide creations here alone. Even now, his valorous frequency lingers on it.

Options.PlotLineKey: Were you his student too?
Were you in the Lion Beast hunt?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not exactly. I never earned Master Cato's recognition. And no, I wasn't part of that hunt. That old hunter aided Augusta while I was back at camp nursing my wounds.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Augusta... hero of Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After her hometown was torn apart by the Dark Tide, she trained under Cato, the legendary Gladiator. Then, she slayed the Lion Beast that plagued the Plateaus, defeated a hundred foes in front of all Septimont, and eventually won Arsinosa's blessing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And me? I was just one of the supporting roles in her legend.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How long are you going to cling to this obsession, Aeolus?

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "A man with neither talent nor resolve is unfit to be my student." That was the only thing Cato ever said to you, wasn't it? And you still see him as your mentor?

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Always spouting that nonsense—"Your weapon is your second life."

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That Augusta girl defeated a hundred Gladiators and took their blades. Do you think someone like her would remember the name of a weak man like you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, maybe you were close to heroes. But it doesn't make you one.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just look at yourself. You're old, Aeolus. One swipe of that Kerasaur's tail could snap your bones in half.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've had enough of hearing how Gladiators die out here chasing empty glory. It's ridiculous.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And it's even worse when it's my friend caught in this madness.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So quit being a Gladiator, Aeolus. Don't you get it? You're aging too fast as a Resonator.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gren
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't want to dig another grave in this cursed place.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Gren uncorks a bottle of wine and pours it out before Cato's grave. Then he turns and walks away.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bezos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. So Aeolus eventually decided to join Gren's team. I'll file his withdrawal application then.

Options.PlotLineKey: Who are Gren and his team, anyway?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bezos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Master Gren used to be the teammate of Master Cato, Ephor Augusta's mentor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bezos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When all of Septimont was watching with bated breath the duel between Augusta and Arsinosa, signs of the Dark Tide surfaced again on the Plateaus. Master Cato went alone into the Wastelands to face it, and never returned.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bezos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Gren blames Master Cato's death on the ingrained defects of the Plateau's logistics and support system. He traced that failure back to the former Ephor's compromises with the nobles. And so, his entire team withdrew from the Gladiator ranks.

Options.PlotLineKey: But what does this have to do with Aeolus?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bezos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Very few know the truth. That day, Master Cato wasn't the only one who went to the Wastelands. Aeolus followed him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bezos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But to uphold the legend of Cato's solitary last stand, Aeolus's name was left out of the story.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bezos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I understand why he chose to join Gren. But still... it's a shame. He was so close to claiming the glory he longed for.

Options.PlotLineKey: But he's no longer young.
And that glory might have cost him his life.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bezos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Such is the fate of a Gladiator, {Male=Sir.;Female=Lady.} {PlayerName}—

Dialogues.Speaker: Bezos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Born for glory. Die for glory.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aeolus stands before Cato's grave in silence. He tries to hold himself upright, but you can still see the stoop in his posture.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Time hasn't treated him kindly.

Options.PlotLineKey: (Say something.)
(Remain silent.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't know much about Septimont's culture, or you. But I respect your choice.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Should we return to the Hunter's Den or Gren's camp?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You don't know much about the Gladiator before you, but it's clear that fate has taken much from him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All you can do is offer him silent respect.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...{PlayerName}, Champion of the Great Agon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I, Gladiator Aeolus, hereby challenge you to a duel.

Options.PlotLineKey: It won't prove anything.
I refuse.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Draw your blade.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Without holding back, you finish this match in just a few seconds.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I lost.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, bring the Corrosaurus's intel back to the Hunter's Den. Tell them I'm sorry and I won't be going back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Right. There's no point in challenging you. What was I even doing...

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, bring the Corrosaurus's intel back to the Hunter's Den. Tell them I'm sorry and I won't be going back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeolus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You go first. I'll stay here for a while.
